content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
- Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0) – Smelts iron ore into iron plates.
- Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores produced iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Consists of:
- Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0) – Extracts iron ore.
- Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5) – Transfers ore from the transport belt to the primary mining chest; now configured with pickup at (-15.5, -49.5) and drop at (-13.5, -49.5).
- Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -49.5) – Delivers ore from the mining drill.
- Iron Chest (position: -13.5, -49.5) – Serves as the primary mining chest for storing extracted ore.
- Intermediate Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -47.5) – Feeds ore from the primary chest to the remote branch.
- Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -47.5) – Transfers ore from the intermediate belt.
- Remote Output Chest (position: -13.5, -47.5) – Stores ore delivered by the remote burner inserter.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Crafting and Sub-ingredient Supply
  - Ensure that all required sub-ingredients (e.g. iron-gear-wheels, iron plates) are available or producible via proper facilities before initiating a craft.

• Extraction and Entity Content Validation
  - Validate the existence and inventory content of target entities before attempting extraction operations.

• Blocked Path and Connection
  - When encountering a blocked transport belt, clear or replace it promptly to restore proper connectivity between structures.

• General API, Placement, and Fuel Management
  - Verify that target positions are unoccupied and buildable, ensuring placements occur within allowable distances; routinely monitor fuel levels for burner-powered entities.

• Improper Inserter Alignment and Rotation Adjustments
  - Confirm the resulting pickup and drop positions immediately after rotating an inserter to ensure proper alignment with connected belts and chests.
  - Avoid repeated reorientation by validating the configuration after the initial adjustment to prevent temporary blockages.
